data.message:
REMINDER:  Polling locations have changed this year.

(Generally speaking, people living in the Downtown Lowell area will be voting at the Lowell High Cafeteria.)

Changes:
WARD TWO (2) Precinct 1 Has moved from Pollard Memorial Library to > Lowell High School Cafeteria 
WARD TWO (2) Precinct 2 Has moved from Lowell Telecommunications Corp (LTC) to > Lowell High School Cafeteria Fall 2016
WARD TWO (2) Precinct 3 Has moved from Lowell Telecommunications Corp (LTC) to > Lowell High School Cafeteria Fall 2016

If you have doubts, you can check here.  http://wheredoivotema.com/bal/MyElectionInfo.aspx

data.caption: Waterways Vitality Draft Plan Review
data.description: You are invited to join the Lowell Heritage Partnership, City of Lowell, and other partners as we gather to for this important review

data.message:
#Lowell Early voting starts on Monday.

Early voting will take place beginning Monday, October 24th through Friday, November 4th. Voters may vote at any early voting location in the community, which includes Lowell City Hall. For a complete schedule on early voting locations, dates and times visit the link below

If you have any questions about early voting, please contact the Election and Census Office at (978) 674-4046.

The Early Voting Community Calendar is available at: http://www.lowellma.gov/law/elections/Documents/2016%20Early%20Voting%20Community%20Calendar.pdf
data.name: www.lowellma.gov

data.description: The Lowell Sustainability Council’s 2nd Sustainability Summit will be held tomorrow (Saturday, October 22, 2016) from 10:00 am to 1:30 pm at Enterprise Bank’s Community Room, 18 Palmer Street, 2nd floor (opposite The Coffee Mill). The free event is open to the public. The Summit will bring together…

data.message:
Please join the Lowell Heritage Partnership to review and comment on the Draft Action Plan of the Waterways Vitality Project on Thursday, October 27 at 6 PM at the UMass Lowell Innovation Hub, 3rd Floor. Working groups will be formed to solicit final comments before publication of the report, which is due in December. Community participation has been a key ingredient as to the success and momentum this initiative has gained. Your input is very important and you are encouraged to attend.
​
For additional information and a copy of the working draft of the plan, please visit www.lowellheritagepartnership.org/next

data.story: Lowell Downtown Neighborhood Association (LDNA) shared Lowell Votes's post.
data.message: Early voting in #Lowell! Many days/locations are convenient for downtown residents
data.name: Lowell Votes
data.description:
The Lowell Elections Office just released this:

For the first time this fall, the City of Lowell will be allowing voters to cast their ballots prior to Election Day. Voters will have the option to cast their ballot at an early voting location, by mail, or at your polling location on Election Day.
 
Early voting is very much like absentee voting, only difference is voters don’t need a justification or explanation to vote early.
 
Early voting will take place beginning Monday, October 24th through Friday, November 4th.  Voters may vote at any early voting location in the community, which includes Lowell City Hall. For a complete schedule on early voting locations, dates and times visit the link below
 
If you have any questions about early voting, please contact the Election and Census Office at (978) 674-4046.

Early voting times and locations:
http://www.lowellvotes.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/2016-Early-Voting-Community-Calendar.pdf
